subject: Re: Home page
preview: Hi Bailey,    Absolutely - here's some further data for you regarding your rankings.    We are seeing significant upward movement, particularly with several key terms breaking onto Page 1:    Bay of F

full_threads.body:
Hi Bailey,

Absolutely - here's some further data for you regarding your rankings.

We are seeing significant upward movement, particularly with several key terms breaking onto Page 1:

  • Bay of Fires Tours: Ranked #9 (A high-volume win at 110 searches!)

  • Walking Tour Tasmania: Ranked #10 - Up from #13 (Page 2)

  • Tasmania Walking Tours: Ranked #17 - Up from #23 (Page 2)


Regarding fresh visibility (new rankings):

  • Great Ocean Road Walking Tour: Ranked #13 (New entry)

  • Three Capes Tasmania: Ranked #30 (New entry)

  • Victoria Walking Tours: Ranked #55 (New entry)


Here's the proposal we gave back in October, you'll see the monthly SEO plan at the bottom. Please feel free to ask any questions!

Park Trek Proposal [Oct]

Thanks,



Ava Webster

Project Manager



☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au

Hi Ava,

Happy New Year! We hope the same to you and your family 😊

Thanks for reaching out with your insights. While it's great to have the #1 spot for our brand name, I'm not sure "park treks Australia" is a term potential buyers are using most to find experiences like ours. Are you able to share some of the other high-impact terms we're ranking high for?

Can you please remind us of the Monthly SEO Plan options for "Part 2" and your best pricing for the New Year? Apologies if you've sent previously, we've had a lot of email chains!

Thanks for your help.

Best,

Bailey Hoadley | General Manager

Park Trek Walking Holidays

Join our Park Trek Mailing List

Schedule a call with us here: http://calendly.com/parktrek-info/15min

e: info@parktrek.com.au
p: 1300 775 875

p: +61 3 9997 0500

w: http://www.parktrek.com.au/

Follow or like us on Instagram or Facebook

We acknowledge the Traditional Owners of Country and recognise their continuing connection to

land, waters, skies and culture. We pay our respect to their Elders past, present and emerging.

We support the Uluru Statement from the Heart.

This message is confidential and may be legally privileged, If you are not the intended recipient do not disclose or

use the information in it. If you receive this email in error, email or call on +61 3 9997 0500 and delete the email.

Afternoon Charles + Bailey,

Hope you both had a fantastic break with family!

Thanks for reaching out re the recent SEO efforts we implemented, I've spoken with our growth team and can share the below data.


  • We've secured the #1 spot for high-impact terms like "park trek walking holidays" and "park treks australia."

  • Our SEO strategy is working exactly as planned-35.8% of our ranking keywords now carry "Commercial Intent," which means it's specifically attracting users who are ready to book.

  • Trust in the brand is undeniable; nearly 60% of our organic traffic comes from people searching for "Park Trek" by name.



It's worth noting to ensure the results we've achieved continue to grow, a monthly SEO plan (mentioned as an option in our proposal) is key. This allows us to proactively manage your visibility and provide you with monthly insights into your traffic. If anything changes on your end and you become interested, we're happy to help.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,



Ava Webster

Project Manager



☎ 1300 072 134

✉ ava@wolfiq.com.au
they needed updates with the growth team, will reply to them here: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/3189587236/184830?viewId=2307525

Hi @allieB , just checked analytics@wolfiq and support@wolfiq GA4 and GSC - we don't have records for them there
For the SEO, can you confirm @adriane if we did the SEO items for parktrek, then once confirmed have Ava/Marketing team audit and see if its all good

hey @adriane please disregard his server details according to his previous email: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/3158116272/180301?viewId=2307530

For SEO metrics (yep we will reply)

Hi WolfIQ Team,
Can you please send me the server details as promised.
Can you also let me know how SEO metrics are looking since your works.
Thank you,
Charles

Hi Charles,

Thanks for sending this through.

We’ve reviewed the "Explore our Guided Walking Holidays" section, and we can confirm that all the tiles are now linking correctly to the specific tour pages.

To answer your question: You definitely made the right call here. From a user experience perspective, these main feature tiles should absolutely link directly to the booking/information pages rather than blog posts (which, as you noted, sit better in the "Latest News" section).

Great catch on updating those!

Let us know if there is anything else you’d like us to cast an eye over.

Hi @adriane @marcelo,

Upon checking the "Charles" already made the changes and it seems that the links are linked properly.

(Time: 15mins)
-joel

——————————-
Hi Charles,

We’ve had a look at the “Explore our Guided Walking Holidays” section and can confirm that all tiles are now linking correctly to the tour pages.
Please let me know if you’d like anything adjusted or reviewed further — happy to help.

action.text: Adriane Roa assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi Wolf IQ Team

Just got some feedback (below) - were the tiles and links under "Explore our Guided Walking Holidays" supposed to be leading to blog posts or the tour pages?

I think they are probably supposed to be going to the tour pages and I have updated accordingly - however let me know if it was otherwise intended.

Thanks


To: Charles Thompson <charles@parktrek.com.au>
Subject: Homepage website updates & Feedback

Hi Charles,

I have been looking at your homepage and I think the following links need to be updated to the booking pages for each walk, rather than a blog post (then the section underneath latest news and stories can have the information/overview blog posts) -

Under this heading -

Explore our Guided Walking Holidays

Step into the Adventure!


  1. Great Ocean Road - currently links to a post about booking the hike for 2022
  2. Three Capes - currently links to blog article on 'why you'll love it' - but probably should be to the walk information page - https://www.parktrek.com.au/three-capes-tasman-peninsula-4-day/
  3. Bay of Fires - currently links to blog article on 'why you'll love it' - but probably should be to the walk information page
  4. Light to Light - this is just to a testimonial page by the looks
  5. Cradle Mountain - currently links to blog article on 'why you'll love it' - but probably should be to the walk information page
  6. Larapinta - currently links to a post from 2016
  7. Snowys - currently links to a post on preparation
